intro: Conyza coronopifolia, commonly known as white cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in the summer months. It is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. Conyza coronopifolia is also known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments.
